author: johnnydex

review: Not a tech person at all. But from what I had read in news articles, Apple TV was supposed to be a kind of substitute for cable TV for people who need TV but not that much. So when I got Apple TV for  a gift I was very excited to say the least.  I have been messing around with my Apple tv but I don't really understand what Apple TV is. You can get Netflix but you have to pay for it. I can get netflix through my DVD player or go to red box, so why get Apple tv. It has an HBO app, but you need to be paying for HBO to use it, and I can access the same stuff it offers through ONDEMAND with my cable provider. Again, I dont need AppleTV to get what it offers. It has Youtube, again, I don't need appletv to watch youtube videos. It offers shows, which again you have to pay for and I can get from my cable provider, usually for free. It has ESPN, again I don't need APPLETV to watch ESPN.I am sure for tech people, they can sync their ipad and their macs with Apple TV and do wonderful things, but for me, I don't  see what it offers really. Netflix and youtube videos?I am still totally searching for the point of having AppleTV.

review: If you look up the model #, it was placed under the US Amazon website when it should have been listed on the Amazon UK site.  New from the UK site is 129 pounds so i guess that is a discount.  Not sure if the UK model can be used in US, but make sure you know what you are getting before you buy this.  The US model 3rd generation (newest) is listed for $84 now, so not too difficult to figure out which one to buy.

I use it so that I did not have to order another expensive DVR from the cable company... The interface it the highlight of this device though using the tiny remote can be a pain for large handed people.
